questions.explanation:
1954.

	Tobias Zachary Ziegler was born on December 23, 1954 in Brighton Beach, New York.

questions.text: What school were the Whiffenpoofs from?
questions.explanation:
Yale.

	The Whiffenpoofs have been a staple at Yale since 1909. The name came to being because of the cheerful attitude the men had.

questions.text: In this episode, did Will look at the Oval Office?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Will (to Charlie): "It's way over the line of demarcation."

questions.text: What subject did Stanley Keyworth hate?
What did President Bartlet get on his SAT's?
questions.explanation:
1590.

	Leo got a 1400 on his SAT's. Bartlet took his SAT's a second time.

questions.text: How many words did 'US Weekly' write about Zoey's boyfriend, Jean Paul?
Did Leo authorize Toby's father to be in the White House?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Josh was the person who made it all right for Julie Ziegler to be in the White House. He did it because "I would give anything to have a living father who was a felon, or a sister with a past."

questions.text: What did Julie Ziegler do after he left Murder Inc.?
questions.explanation:
Made ladies raincoats.

	Toby told Will what his father did after Will told him that they talked while Julie was in Toby's office.

questions.text: How many U.S. Marshals were going to guard Zoey's door during Christmas in Manchester?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The President also told Zoey that two Marshals were going to be guarding Jean Paul's door as well.

questions.text: Toby told Will to drink when he went home.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Toby (to Will): "Manage the pain. Don't be a hero."
